unless.translation[0].definitions[0].def: used to say that something will happen or be true if something else does not happen or is not true
unless.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Unless some extra money is found, the theatre will close.
I think you should complain – unless, of course, you are happy with the way things are.
He won’t go to sleep unless you tell him a story.
I can’t leave her unless I know she’s all right.
unless.translation[0].note_box[0].items[: You use the simple present tense with unless
Unless the government changes its policy, the economic situation will get worse
Don’t use ‘will’ in the clause after unless
Unless the government will change its policy
You can also use the present perfect tense with unless
I won’t change anything unless someone has asked me to
unless someone will have asked me to
unless someone will ask me to
To talk about the past, use the simple past with unless
Unless the company got a loan, it would go bankrupt
They threatened to kill him unless he gave them the money
Unless the company would get a loan
unless.translation[0].note_box[1].headin: USAGE: Unless, in case, or else
unless.translation[0].note_box[1].items[: You use unless when saying that if something does not happen, something else will happen
Unless I hear from you  (=if I don’t hear from you), I’ll assume everything’s OK
You use in case when saying that you do something in order to be prepared if something happens
Take a sweater in case you get cold
You use or else when saying that something bad will happen if you do not do something
You’d better go now, or else you’ll miss the train
